title: How to Avoid Being a Noob on Halo 3

steps.headline: Know your weaponry.
steps.description: Don't mistake power drain for the bubble shield, don't think tapping RT fires the spartan laser, get to know your weapons first.

steps.headline: Don't brag about armor, or try to use the Katana.
steps.description: If you have some armor, pretty much everyone has it. Most of the time someone on the field will be wearing hayabusa, so don't brag.

steps.headline: Learn to aim quickly and well.
steps.description: This means you can fire a sniper rifle or a plasma grenade and hit. If you can't fire a sniper rifle, either take it some place people don't think of or give it to a teammate.

steps.headline: Learn what has changed between versions of the game.
steps.description: Don't play Halo 3 as if it were Halo 2.

steps.headline: Use the radar.
steps.description: You need this tool to find people who are getting ready to ambush you. Spot them first to avoid looking foolish.

steps.headline: Learn the layout of the maps, especially the popular ones.
steps.description: Know the good spots to be, where the best stuff is, and where ambushes may come from. If you get really used to it, start making ambushes of your own.

steps.headline: Be a good teammate.
steps.description: This means paying attention to what your teammates are doing so that you can help, or at least avoid hurting them. Of course, never intentionally kill your teammates.

steps.headline: Remember, you can't survive the turrets or mines or whatever.
steps.description: Don't try to think you can escape through there. You have a chance of surviving on a thrusting ghost, but it's better not to try it.

steps.headline: Remember that the bubble shield is not invincible.
steps.description: There are ways to die even when you are using it.

steps.headline: Talk with your teammates.
steps.description: You need to conspire with teammates if you want to win. Matchmaking doubles need headphones to win.

steps.headline: Don't run away from a fight.
steps.description: If you run away people will think you're new and call you noob. Always fight, even if you don't think you can win.

steps.headline: Make sure you don't go solo in a team game.
Don't teabag or melee dead people.
steps.description: It's noobish, will make the person angry at you, and wastes time. You'll pretty much die if they respawn next to you.

steps.headline: Use a weapon you're proficient with.
steps.description: Don't waste time trying to get a mega weapon that you cannot even use well.

steps.headline: Don't bother going back to where you last died for your equipment.
steps.description: Someone has taken it, or they will be waiting for you to come back and kill you again.

steps.headline: Don't blame dying on lag.
steps.description: Making excuses is poor sportsmanship. Accept that you're dead - and get revenge.

steps.headline: Accept it when you get killed.
Always use other weapons.
steps.description: You should never use the same gun every single time. People will call you a noob for doing this. Why do you think they have other guns?

steps.headline: Don't all ways keep hiding.
steps.description: There is no point at hiding all the time. The more times you hide the more times you will be called a noob.

steps.headline: Don't swear when you die because they will think you are so addicted to it and they will laugh at you and just try to kill you!

If you get really used to it, start making ambushes of your own. Be a good teammate. This means paying attention to what your teammates are doing so that you can help, or at least avoid hurting them. Of course, never intentionally kill your teammates. Remember, you can't survive the turrets or mines or whatever. Don't try to think you can escape through there. If you run away people will think you're new and call you noob. Always fight, even if you don't think you can win. Make sure you don't go solo in a team game. It's team for a reason. Don't teabag or melee dead people. It's noobish, will make the person angry at you, and wastes time. You'll pretty much die if they respawn next to you. Use a weapon you're proficient with. Don't waste time trying to get a mega weapon that you cannot even use well. Don't bother going back to where you last died for your equipment. Someone has taken it, or they will be waiting for you to come back and kill you again. Don't blame dying on lag. Making excuses is poor sportsmanship. Accept that you're dead - and get revenge. Accept it when you get killed. You can always have revenge. Always use other weapons. You should never use the same gun every single time. People will call you a noob for doing this. Don't swear when you die because they will think you are so addicted to it and they will laugh at you and just try to kill you!
